oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Single Incision Device (TVT Secur) Versus Retropubic Tension-free Vaginal Tape Device (TVT) for the Management of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women: A Randomized Clinical Trial
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ross, Sue
Tang, Selphee
Schulz, Jane
Murphy, Magnus
Goncalves, Jose
Kaye, Stephen
Dederer, Lorel
Robert, Magali
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this Canadian multi-centre pragmatic randomized controlled trial was to compare the effectiveness of the new single-incision device, Gynecare TVT Secur, to the established predecate retropubic TVT device, in terms of objective cure of stress urinary incontinence (SUI) at 12 months postoperatively. Other outcomes included: complications, symptoms, and incontinence-related quality of life.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
single incision device
stress urinary incontinence
surgical treatment
effectiveness
randomized controlled trial
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Urogenital Distress Inventory (UDI-6); Incontinence Impact Questionnaire (IIQ-7); the Pelvic Organ Prolapse/Urinary Incontinence Sexual Questionnaire-12, (PISQ-12); the 15D Instrument of Health-related Quality of Life (15D) was included for the proposed economic evaluation which was never done.
